metadata.title: CVE-2022-46705 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A spoofing issue existed in the handling of URLs. This issue was addressedwith improved input validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 16.2 and iPadOS16.2, macOS Ventura 13.1, Safari 16.2. Visiting a malicious website maylead to address bar spoofing.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.38.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.38.4-0ubuntu0.20.04.2').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
